titleStmt.title: A. Smith et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7110

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Mount Vernon Ky
October 11th 1865
To his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned your petitioners would Respectfully state that the last February Term of the Rockcastle Circuit Court John Woodyard was fined the Sum of $20 -- for Selling one glass pint of Black Berry Cordial.

We would further State that Said Woodyard is an old man unable to work or come to Town and that he is a very poor man and unable to pay the Same, and that his is a Case clearly demanding Executive Clemency we Therefor take pleasure in asking your Excellency to Remit said fine --

A. Smith C. R. Co. Ct
R D. Cook S. R. C
D. N. Lewis C. R. C
N. Whitehead J, P, R, C,
M A Brooks
S. H Thompson

Rockcastle Cir Ct.
vs
John Woodyard
Remitted 14th Oct 1865
$20,
